org.joonegap
Class ChromosomeManager

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--org.joonegap.ChromosomeManager
public class ChromosomeManager
extends java.lang.Object

ChromosomeManager manages the...

  • loading and saving (to disk)
  • pairing up for competition
  • evolving (when enough have competed)
...of all Chromosomes in the Genotype. In this way, it is a one-stop shop for clients wishing to get hold of new Chromosomes and play them in matches, without worrying about their being saved, or keeping score, or when they need evolving.

(note that all public methods are synchronized)

ChromosomeManager

public ChromosomeManager(java.io.File p_fileGenes,
                         boolean p_bAllowLoadingPreviouslySavedGenes,
                         int p_iMinimumPopulationSize,
                         int p_iGamesPerGeneration,
                         Gene[] p_arraySampleGenes,
                         boolean p_bRandomizeSampleGenes,
                         Configuration p_configuration,
                         Logger p_logger)
Parameters:
p_fileGenes - the folder in which to store the genes
p_bAllowLoadingPreviouslySavedGenes - whether to load any genes found in p_fileGenes
p_iMinimumPopulationSize - the desired population size (the population size may fluctuate above this at times)
p_iGamesPerGeneration - the minimum number of games a chromosome must play (they may occasionally play more)
p_configuration - the pre-initialized JGAP Configuration object, or null to have ChromosomeManager initialize a default configuration
p_logger -
Method Detail

holdChromosome

public org.jgap.Chromosome holdChromosome()
Get, at random, the next chromosome competitor. It is intended the client throw this chromosome object away after creating a neural network from it.

The chromosome is considered 'held' pending the resulting score of any game it plays (passed back by calling gameOver), and being 'released' (by calling releaseChromosome).

If there are no more competitors waiting to play in a game, the genotype is evolved 'just in time', and an evolved chromosome is returned.

gameOver

public void gameOver(java.lang.String p_strID,
                     java.lang.Boolean p_boolWon)
Increment/decrement the chromosome's score

releaseChromosome

public void releaseChromosome(java.lang.String p_strID)
Release the chromosome (so that it may be considered for evolution)

getGenerations

public int getGenerations()
Returns:
number of generations completed since the class was instantiated
